properties.name: 1 - Home
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek Home sweet home! Okee, Wisconsin...the journey begins here!

properties.name: 10 - Jeju Island, South Korea
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek We visited this volcanic island during a four day weekend in May. The beaches here were beautiful. We made our way around the island starting from the airport heading east. Highlights: scuba diving in Seogwipo, a 4am hike up a volcano to watch the sunrise, pottery making, waterfalls, etc.

properties.name: 11 - Sokcho, South Korea
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek We spent a night here during our week long tour of the west coast during our summer vacation, the first week of August. A small town complete with a beach and 5 man saxophone band. The beach here is lined with barbed wire to protect against North Korean spies from swimming up the shore. From here we made our way to Seoraksan National Park.

properties.name: 12 - Seoraksan National Park
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek We spent the day hiking in the light rain, with our back packs, up to a waterfall. On our way down we took a rest on the rocks by the river soaking in the amazing view. Then a cable car ride through the mist to the top of a mountain. We couldn\'t see anything once we got up there so we just ate a Korean sweet pancake then went back down. I nice stroll through a temple and then we walked back to town, Seorakdong. There we found a slightly (ok very) creepy hostel to spend the night. It was empty save a few rooms. So we, of course, proceded to make a horror film in the halls, basement, and attic. I regretful and against my will became the star of this film (as I was apparently the only one who was scared!).

properties.name: 2 - O'Hare Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek ORDDrove to lovely and exciting O\'Hare Aiport and made my way to London, England...and eventually Ruskington.

properties.name: 3 - London, England
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek london, englandThis isn\'t the aiport, but I don\'t really know where that is. Wayne picked me up from the airport and we started the drive to Ruskington...with a quick stop in Cambridge.

properties.name: 4 - Ruskington, England
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek I spent a few days with Wayne\'s family in Ruskington before heading back to Heathrow and on to Busan!

properties.name: 5 - Incheon Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek A quick layover in Incheon Airport, I emailed my family to let them know I\'d arrived safely as I watch the sunrise over the runway.

properties.name: 6 - My Apartment in Busan
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek My second apartment in Korea...where I lived 11 months.

properties.name: 7 - My School, SLP
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek Affectionately known as the \'Slave Labor Program\', I spent most of my days (and hours) on the fourth floor of this building, teaching kindergarten and elementary school students. The kids were awesome! The management...not so much. Actual school name: Sogang Language Program

properties.name: 8 - Seoul, South Korea
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek I took probably about 5 trips to Seoul during my 13 months in Korea. To see the sights, do some Christmas shopping, and visit friends. I really liked the city...a lot to do, and it never felt like a city of 10 million people. But I was always glad to get back to my beach city of Busan.

properties.name: 9 - Gyeongju, South Korea
properties.description: Posted by Rebeccajanek A day trip in Gyeongju when Wayne\'s friend, Pete, was in town. We saw burial mounds from 600 b.c., old temples, a Buddist grotto (where I may or may not have been bitten by a snake. Only Buddah knows), a field of lillies, and Dominos Pizza. A small, well kept up city with lots to do. The scenery was very beautiful. It reminded me a bit of Jeju Island, as I believe it is a resort area of Korea.
